response_parsed.title: Property Testing CLI Tools with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to use FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, to property test Command Line Interface (CLI) tools in Python 3.12+ using the Hypothesis library.
key_points: Create a FastAPI application with CLI functionality.
Use Hypothesis to generate test data for property-based testing.
Test command-line arguments, function behavior, and other properties of the CLI tool.
Leverage Uvicorn to run the FastAPI application as a standalone server for testing via CLI.

code_examples.code:
```python

from fastapi import Depends, HTTPException
from pydantic import BaseModel
from typing import Any
import hypothesis
import hypothesis.strategies as st

class Args(BaseModel):
    arg1: str
    arg2: int

@hypothesis.given(
    args = st.lists(st.one_of(st.just('arg1'), st.just('arg2'))),
)
def test_cli(args: Any):
    # Your property-based tests here
```
